definition: the Americas/abbr. for 美洲[Mei3 zhou1]/USA/abbr. for 美國|美国[Mei3 guo2]
beautiful/very satisfactory/good/to beautify/to be pleased with oneself
to make into/to change into/-ization/to ... -ize/to transform/abbr. for 化學|化学[hua4 xue2]

sentences.english: Integrate human and culture, beautify environment.
You can not only beautify the environment, in order to add a luster to the world.
sentences.chinese: 你不仅可以美化环境，为世界增添一份光彩。

sentences.english: And, you know, I don't glorify any kind of misbehavior or misuse of anything.
sentences.chinese: 而且，你知道，我不会美化任何不当的举动。

sentences.english: Forest park, beautify the national environment, for, make the tourism, have.
sentences.chinese: 森林公园，美化国家环境，对于，搞好旅游事业，有。

sentences.english: The aesthetics pursue of teleplay is "the aestheticization of everyday life".
sentences.chinese: 电视剧的美学追求是“日常生活的审美化”。

sentences.english: She embellishes her pumpkins to a nice effect as you can see.
sentences.chinese: 她美化她的南瓜一个很好的效果可以看到。

sentences.english: 'Clean the environment, beautify our surroundings', why did the urban tourists ignore it?
sentences.chinese: “净化环境，美化家园”，难道城里人也不懂吗？

sentences.english: He denies that the movie glorifies violence.
sentences.chinese: 他否认这部影片美化暴力。

sentences.english: In fact, there is a definite attempt to popularize and glamorize sin.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，大家还在努力把罪美化，让它更受欢迎。

sentences.english: The administrative budget pretties up the picture of Government .
sentences.chinese: 预算美化了政府开支的形象。

sentences.english: And blood splatters everywhere in glorious slow motion.
sentences.chinese: 而且把四溅的鲜血用慢镜头来加以美化。

sentences.english: And the myth should show us this life in order to thus transfigure it?
sentences.chinese: 那么，神话指示出这种生活，是为了替我们美化它吗？

sentences.english: The southern part of the axis has proved more difficult to beautify.
sentences.chinese: 中轴线的南边部分则比较难美化。

sentences.english: Landscaping will be used for leisure or irrigated as agricultural land.
sentences.chinese: 景观美化将最作为休闲活动区或用于农业灌溉用地。

sentences.english: You will learn to accept things as they are, and move within that landscape mindfully.
sentences.chinese: 你将学习接受事情本身，只在其中变化并谨慎地美化。

sentences.english: The channel agreed to cut scenes in future which glamorise or condone smoking.
sentences.chinese: 该频道同意以后将剪掉所有美化和宽容吸烟的镜头。

definition: to paint/to whitewash/to decorate/plaster/fig. to gloss over/to cover up
to model/to mold/(fig.) to create (a character, a market, an image etc)/(literature) to portray (in words)
to decorate/to adorn/to dress up/to polish (a written piece)/to qualify or modify (grammar)
rendering (computing)/to add washes of ink or color to a drawing (Chinese painting)/to exaggerate/to embellish
to look completely new (idiom); brand new/changed beyond recognition
